pros: Excellent health care wonderful people
cons: Really really don't have any problems with this hospital

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Murfreesboro, TN
pros: Not very many to think of.
cons: Place isn’t that terrible. Could use some real work though.

pros: Decent pay(I’m PRN, so I don’t get benefits but I’m paid more per hr) I let me manger know how many days a week I want and she schedules me just like the full time staff. My current manger is understanding and works with us about schedule request, hrs, problems/concerns.  Also my manager stands up for our department instead of letting us be screwed over like some other department  managers.
cons: Not focused on patient care or employees. GREEDY & incompetent upper management. The people making the rules & policies have NO experience AT ALL with how things actually works on the floor (which common sense should tell you isn’t going to yeild the best results). Any recommendations made by staff are disregarded and the only changes made are make things worse.  Only concern is the bottom dollar. Doesn’t try to retain there experienced staff, ‘everyone is replaceable’ mentality. I get in some ways that’s true but when you have a nurse with +10 yrs experience & a new grad nurse they are not interchangeable!

pros: Coworkers become friends and family longterm
cons: Compensation doesn't reflect job expectations/work load, understaffing, lots of unnecessary corporate busy-work

review_title: Was once something great, but their choice in management is lacking.
pros: Best birthing unit around! And best nurses around by far! While I try not to be partial, this unit as well as the facility wide nursing staff are amazing. Many people return to this facility strictly to have their "favorite nurses" care for them or their family. I think that in itself says something.
cons: Management is clique-y and not honest. They also do not take care of their employees as they should at times. Several nurses have had to call the ethics and corporate hotline over the years to have things taken care of because they were not by management.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Winchester, TN
pros: Good co workers and great training for new nurses.
cons: too many patients per nurse. Not enough cna.

review_title: Great hospital and staff but awful staffing ratios
pros: The doctors are great. So are the nurses and nurse support team.
cons: Pay isn’t that great. Staffing is awful. Almost to the point that it is unsafe at some points

pros: Maintained and learned cleanliness and health advice for the future.
cons: They could not keep a positive and professional staff.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Winchester, TN
pros: They care about you and will work with you if you need time off.
cons: I can't think of any cons. It's a nice place to work.

pros: This place was close to my home.
cons: Poor pay and no raises.

pros: It was a good hospital.
cons: They let a lot of great staff go and kept the troublemakers.

pros:
Great Training
Small Patient Load
Friendly Atmosphere
cons:
Doesn't Pay Enough
Benefits Too Expensive
No Overtime/Holiday Pay

higher pay rate
retention bonuses
hardworking therapists

no work life balance
greedy upper management
canceling patients to improve employer productivity
poor upper management to discipline employees
